III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Description qualifications
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/5/25, two youth physically assaulted Youth A. While the
incident was occurring, Team Leader and Staff 2 stood by and
laughed rather than intervening. Two other staff became aware
and did intervene. Youth A incurred various bruises on her body
and face and was treated at the hospital. Administration observed
video footage and denied that the allegations are true, but staff
witnesses validated that they are true.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 05/08/2025.
Complainant noted she heard these concerns from staff who
witnessed the incident.
Consumer Rights Officer was interviewed at the facility on
05/09/2025, in collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Consumer
Rights Officer confirmed Youth A was involved in a physical
altercation with Youth B and Youth C. He reviewed the video
footage and did not see staff members not intervening or laughing.
He said there were three staff members, Team Leader, Staff 1,
and Staff 2 that intervened and separated the three youth, then
police were notified, and Youth A was taken to the hospital for a
medical exam and was cleared with no injuries.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 05/09/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the
facility for one month. Youth A reported the day of the fight, Youth
B and Youth C jumped her and kicked and punched her. She said
staff were laughing and did not intervene. She said one staff
member was trying to help, but she could not recall her name.
Youth A could not identify who the staff were that were laughing.
She said she had almost passed out, so she was taken to the
hospital. Youth A denied any injuries or bruises. Youth A
expressed she does not feel safe because of Youth B and Youth
C.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 05/09/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth B has been at the
facility for three weeks. Youth B reported on 05/05/2025, Youth A
2

was threatening to fight her, so when Youth A came at her, she
and Youth C fought Youth A. She said Youth A is always running
her mouth and saying she wants to fight her. She denied
witnessing staff laughing. She said Team Leader, Staff 1, and
Staff 2 did intervene and separated Youth A, Youth B and Youth
C. Youth B said the police were contacted and she and Youth A
were taken to the hospital for a medical exam. Youth B reported
no injuries from the fight.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 05/09/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth C has been at the
facility for almost three weeks. Youth C reported Youth A is very
“sloppy” and refused to clean the bathroom after she showered.
She asked Youth A to pick up her stuff from the bathroom and
Youth A refused and cussed at her. Youth C told Youth A she was
going to slap her and that’s when Youth A jumped over staff and
she (Youth C) and Youth B fought Youth A. Youth C said Team
Leader and Staff 1 immediately intervened and broke up the fight.
She denied witnessing staff laughing or not trying to stop the fight.
Youth D was interviewed at the facility on 05/09/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth D denied being
involved in the fight, however she did witness the fight. Youth D
reported Youth A had been threatening to fight Youth C for about
a week. She said Youth A and Youth C exchanged words and
Youth A attacked Youth C and Youth B. She said Team Leader
and Staff 1 were present and immediately tried to break up the
fight. Team Leader called for assistance and more staff came to
assist. Youth D denied Team Leader or any staff laughing and not
trying to stop the fight.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 05/22/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a youth coach and
has been working at the facility for 7 months. She reported on
05/05/2025, Youth B told her at the beginning of her shift she and
Youth A were going to fight. Staff 1 informed Team Leader that
Youth A and Youth B need to be separated. She said Team
Leader told her she was aware and took Youth B and Youth C
outside on the patio. Later in the evening, when Youth B and
Youth C came back on the unit and kept antagonizing Youth A.
Youth B and Youth C were making fun of Youth A’s accent and
made a remark about Youth A’s father. Youth A was getting very
upset, she and Team Leader attempted to verbally de-escalate
the situation, however Youth A was escalated, and went after
Youth B. She immediately intervened and tried to separate the
Youth A, Youth B and Youth C. She said Team Leader was
3

standing and not trying to intervene. Staff 2 came on the unit and
tried to verbally de-escalate Youth A, Youth B and Youth C to stop
fighting. She and Staff 2 made a barrier to break up the fight. She
said Team Leader and Staff 2 acting like they were trying to stop
the fight, but she did not feel that they did enough. They
eventually separated Youth A, Youth B and Youth C, and the
police were contacted.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 05/22/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is a youth coach and
has been working at the facility for one year. Staff 2 denied Team
Leader was laughing and not intervening. When she arrived at the
unit, she saw Team Leader trying to separate Youth A, Youth B
and Youth C with Staff 1. Staff 2 said all the staff on the unit tried
to stop the fight. She denied not attempting to intervene or
laughing while the youths were fighting.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility on 05/22/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Staff 3 reported she was
working on 05/05/2025, however she was on a different unit. She
came to assist after she heard a clear was called, however the
fight was over by the time she arrived. She denied witnessing
Team Leader not intervening or laughing. She witnessed Team
Leader, Staff 1 and Staff 2 engaging with Youth A, Youth B and
Youth C, and trying to de-escalate them.
Team Leader was interviewed via telephone on 06/03/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Team Leader is currently on
medical leave due to an injury. Team Leader reported on
05/05/2025 she was asked to cover Deroy Hall due to a shortage
of staff. Team Leader does not work in Deroy Hall and is not
familiar with the youths. She said there is a partition that
separates the units; however, the youths can easily open the
partition. Team Leader denied being aware of or Staff 1 informing
her Youth B was planning on fighting Youth A. Team Leader
reported Youth B and Youth C were outside on the patio area.
Youth B and Youth C came inside and they were arguing with
Youth A. She and Staff 1 attempted to verbally redirect the youths.
Staff 1 went to the restroom and when she returned, Youth A,
Youth B and Youth C,” went at it again” and that’s when Youth A
jumped over her and attacked Youth B and Youth C. She and
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were standing between the youths trying to
separate them. They were able to separate the youth, call the
police, and Youth A was taken to the hospital for a medical exam.
Team Leader denied not intervening/laughing during the fight.
4

Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 06/05/2025. Staff 4 is a
youth coach and has been working at the facility for one year.
Staff 4 reported on 05/05/2025 she responded to the call for
assistance and when she arrived the fight was over. She denied
staff were not intervening or laughing. Staff 4 was unaware Youth
B was planning on fighting prior to the fight. She is unaware of any
staff member ever encouraging youths to fight.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 05/05/2025 was reviewed on 05/09/2025. Video
began with Youth A, Youth B and Youth C, in the common area
with Team Leader and Staff 1. Youth A, Youth B and Youth C
appear to be exchanging words, Youth B and Youth C push
through the Team Leader and Staff 1 and start punching and
kicking Youth A. Staff 2 comes on the unit and assists Staff 1 and
Team Leader. The staff separate the youths and Youth B and
Youth C leave the common area. Youth A is escorted to her
bedroom. A few seconds later Youth A walks out of her room and
again the Youth A, Youth B and Youth C start fighting. The three
staff attempt to separate the three youths by standing between the
three youths and redirecting the youths.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident reported dated 05/05/2025 at approximately 8:15
pm, written by Staff 1, Youth B and Youth C came in from
being outside on the patio, and started arguing with Youth
A, Staff 1 attempted to verbally de-escalate to stop the
youths from going back and forth. Youth B and Youth C
went back outside and a few minutes later came back
inside and told Youth A they wanted to fight her. However,
Youth B and Youth C continued to antagonize Youth A.
Staff 1 and Team Leader continued to use verbal de-
escalation and stood between the three youths to defuse
the situation. A few minutes later Youth A got up to go to
her room and that’s when Youth B and Youth C went after
Youth A. Staff intervened, and the police were called.
• Facility’s staff and client interactions notes- all staff should
conduct themselves in a professional and appropriate
manner with the youths in their care. Staff must foster
mutual trust and establish positive working relationship.
• Facility’s behavior management policy notes- To maintain a
safe environment for all Vista Maria clients and staff,
behavior management interventions are only used when a
client presents a danger to self or others. These
interventions should only be used when all other less
restrictive behavior management interventions (i.e., verbal
5

de-escalation, therapeutic interventions) have been
explored.
• Medical report for Youth A dated 05/06/2025. An X-ray and
CT scan completed and were negative for fractures. There
was no mention of bruising in the report.
• Team Leader personnel file- performance improvement
plan due to attendance.
• Staff 2 personnel file- no disciplinary actions noted.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance based on interviews with staff,
youths, and video footage reviewed there is insufficient evidence
that staff were not intervening and laughing while Youth A was
assaulted.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility did not have enough staff on duty to provide
supervision.
Investigation Staff 1 reported there was not sufficient staff on the unit to assist
when Youth A, Youth B and Youth C when they were engaged in
a physical altercation. She called a clear and called for assistance,
however staff did not arrive to the unit until after the fight was
over. She said there was not enough staff to attempt to restrain
the youths. She said the situation could have been prevented if
they had more staff, and if Team Leader had made a safety plan
since she verbally informed Team Lead before the fight that Youth
B was going to fight Youth A. She said Youth B was not supposed
to be on the same unit as Youth A. She said Youth B opened the
partition door and was hanging out with Youth C. Staff 1 reported
she overheard Youth B tell Team Leader “You told me to let her
hit me first and that’s what I did.” Staff 1 said Team Leader should
have done more to stop the fight, even though Team Leader was
standing between the youth as a barrier just enough to act like she
was trying to intervene.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 05/09/2025, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Youth B denied Team Leader
told her let Youth A hit her first.
6

Staff 2 reported on 05/05/2025 they were out of ratio. They had
four staff and Team Leader with 9 youths. Staff 2 reported Team
Leader and Staff 1 were trying to stop the fight when she came on
the unit. She was on the other unit and does not know how the
fight started, however she heard that Youth A swung on Youth B
first. Staff 2 was not aware Youth A, Youth B and Youth C were
going to fight beforehand. She does not usually work on this unit
and was not familiar with Youth A, Youth B and Youth C.
Staff 3 reported she was working on another unit and came to
assist when she heard a clear was called. Staff 3 does not know
which staff members were assigned to work on the orange wing
and does not know if they were short staffed.
Team Leader reported they were short staffed on 05/05/2025.
She said there were only four direct care staff, and they had 11
youth on the unit. She said two of the youth were on 1:1’s. Team
Leader said there should have been eight staff on the unit,
however there were only four which made the situation difficult to
control and prevent the youths from fighting. Team Leader denied
being aware of, or Staff 1 informing her Youth B was planning on
fighting Youth A. She further denied encouraging the youths to
fight or telling Youth B to wait for Youth A to hit her first.
Staff 4 reported there were four staff assigned to work at Deroy;
however, they should have had more staff because the girls are
difficult to manage when they are short staffed.
Consumer Rights Officer reported there were 6 staff total, 2 staff
went to the hospital with 2 youths (one of those youth's was on 1:1
supervision), that left 4 staff and 9 youths, one of those youth's
was on 1:1, therefore this left 3 staff and one team leader with 8
youths.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff schedule on 05/05/5025: There were 6 staff
scheduled and 11 youths on the unit. Two youths were on
1:1. Two of the staff went to the hospital with two youths
and one staff left at 7 pm. There were 3 staff left for 9
youths.
• Reviewed daily unit attendance report and there were
six staff and one shift supervisor.
• Facility’s client supervision policy notes- youths on all
units are to be continually supervised. The shift leader or
supervisor remains out of ratio to do periodical walks
7

around the building and be available to assist in crisis
situations. Staff members who are responsible for client
supervision should always maintain line of sight
management of those youths. Staff to client non-school
hours ratio 1:3.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance with the rule, based on
interviews with staff and documentation reviewed, there was
insufficient staff on duty to provide for the protection of the youths.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2023C0000873SI dated 11/09/2023, CAP approved
12/04/2023
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
